question: And how would you feel if someone gave you a pen as a gift?
transcript: You know, totally I am not very okay with gifts. I think that they impose something, Impose something to you that maybe you do not like it, regardless of whatever they give you. But, so I do not think.
transcript_cleaned: You know, totally I am not very okay with gifts. I think that they impose something, Impose something to you that maybe you do not like it, regardless of whatever they give you. But, so I do not think.

grammar: impose something to you -> impose on you
do not like it -> do not like

question: When you were a child, did you enjoy learning history?
transcript: Not really because when we were in school, I believe that they only giving us some, wrong information. So they just twist reality and because of that I did not like to learn history.

grammar_reason: Observation: 'Only giving'. Impact: Noticeable. Justification: **Frequent errors** meets Band 5.

question: Why and why not?
transcript: I think it really does not change. People are the same as the past. But now because of, the ease of communication with, lots of social apps, lots of, digital words, now we can, somehow prove them wrong, more easily than before. At that time, at, for example, ten years ago, there were no telegrams, there were no WhatsApp, and, there were no chats. But now, we can easily show them that here, you promised me something, and now you are right.

But now because of, the ease of communication with, lots of social apps, lots of, digital words, now we can, somehow prove them wrong, more easily than before. question: What is the importance of commitment to work?

question: And how can we teach young children to be committed to their goals and never give up?
transcript: I believe that the best way to teach our youngsters, our children, is to show them how we act. And, for example, when we want to follow our goals, if we are committed to these, goals, they will watch us and learn from us. it is not enough just to tell them this and that. it is not working or anything.

question: What is your favorite type of food?
transcript: I think my favorite food is fried rice. And in particular, I like shrimp fried rice. it is because it is so easy to make. And coming from China, I grew up eating this, this kind of food. So yeah, when I am tired or whenever I am feeling down, I would cook myself a pot of fried rice, you know, mixing with whatever ingredients I feel like on that particular day.

question: How do you usually communicate with your friends?
transcript: I usually use social media apps like Instagram, Discord. As a Chinese, I use WeChat, which is very popular and widely used for a variety of reasons in China. So yeah, with my Canadian friends, I would use Discord, but with my parents or relatives in China, I would use WeChat.

question: And how your hobbies changed since childhood?
transcript: Well, I had myopia problems, as a, as a kid. So I definitely couldn get to play video games because my parents think that staring at a computer screen is a direct cause of myopia so I mostly played with Legos or just hanging out with friends like say playing soccer or basketball at the school grounds You know but then ever since I got my phone and two years later I got my first laptop that when I started playing more video games So there definitely a huge shift from physical to sort of a virtual in an electronic device And do you prefer hobbies that require physical activity or mental engagement? I think I like both. but I think physical activity would have to come first. I have been sitting a lot and recently I learned that I have some back problems being only at 22 years old as a little bit concerning.
